Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: ejp2003
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Lodge was a basic hotel off of Nathan Rd that exceeded my expectations. Unlike many of the photos I've seen the stories I had read, I was expecting it to be impossibly tight and uncomfortable. Not so! They had thick mattresses in our 2 double beds room, and everything was super clean and modest. It was difficult finding the location as there's no signage whatsoever. When you enter Knight's Garden, to find the office, you walk to the 2nd floor of the first stairway on the left. There's only one door, and you can hit the doorbell to get in. The staff was really helpful (and spoke good English) and allowed us to keep our bags in the office after we checked out but before we left town. The only down point beyond finding it was the number of steps you have to deal with if you have a lot of luggage or are tired from coming from the airport. While there is an elevator, it is small and hard to move around in. If you're flying out from HKG, make sure to ask the staff where the A22 bus stop is from the hotel, it's much more convenient than taking the Airport Express back, and costs hk$39 one way.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Yeannie Y
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for 5 days 4 nights. if not because of the full payment that I have made, I would have cancelled my booking on the spot once I saw the hotel. It is located somehow next to a restaurant named spicy mama, thus when you walk around the long corridor (yes, long corridor with stairs, wouldn't be much helpful if you have heavy luggage and travelling with elderly), you'll noticed some weird and annoying cooking smell. The rooms were dirty with lizards and flies and small, not as spacious as it claims. The rooms were cleaned daily throughout my stay however it is still not up to my expectation. Bad air conditioning system and poor lighting. The toilet light was spoil on the very first day of my stay. The stairs are faster than the old elevator. Some of the staff were very friendly, like Paul but for the others, a definitely no-no. The worst part of my stay is that when one of my relative would like to borrow their toilet after check out, and they insist it is not possible because we have check out, everything is on our own. This is so inhumane. Although the hotel is located strategically near to Jordan MTR station and Temple street, there are more others worth-staying hotels nearby, I swear I wouldnt come back to this hotel anymore! Some good points about the hotel is they allowed you to make free IDD call throughout your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, safe, affordable”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyFarFromHome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is apartments converted to groups of small hotel rooms, or so it seems. Plenty of security. Clean and well kept. Easy check in. They asked for HK$100 for a key deposit - OK, just didn't expect it. The stairs are faster than the old elevator. The helpful staff all speak good English. The Internet (wifi) was good most of the time. It is a good value for the money. One thing though - this place is a bit tough to find. There was NO signage that I could see. You have to look for the address, which is clearly marked but you might overlook it if you are looking for a hotel entrance - instead it is just a passage way to an apartment building. The street it is on, Tak Hing, parallels Nathan Rd, a block east of it, very near the Jordan MTR station, so the location is quite convenient in terms of getting places.

Reviews.Title: “recommended...good location...friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: Aissa C
Reviews.Content: Paul was a great help. He's very friendly, approachable and funny nice man. The Filipina staffs were nice too. Our twin bedroom was just fine regarding space...one thing I like most is they kept our room tidy at all times. 3 min.walk to Jordan station, 5 mins. walk to Temple Night Market and just 2 stations away from Ladies Market...the bus stop going to the airport is just a few meters away rom the hotel...very safe even at night...

Reviews.Title: “Never come again”
Reviews.Author: OstapUkraine
Reviews.Content: The standard single room has size 3x2 m. You will have no ability to put inside even luggage. The rest room and shower is outside of the room. Only If you are going to spend only one night there, it will be normal. Or need to book double room.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: James464
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in hongkong in comfort lodge we was disappointed the room very small like 4meter by 3.5 meters with bathroom inside.i can stay in a small room but not with 92USD we expecting that room is comfortable but not. Even the taxi driver brought us in Prudential hotel maybe bacause no space for parking so we walked looking for this hostel by the address Also no name outside.I will never stay again in this hostel

Reviews.Title: “fair”
Reviews.Author: iwanttotravelforfree
Reviews.Content: overnight stay + wifi, so fast back of prudential hotel walking distance everywhere in TST, close to almost everything in Nathan very clean working hot water clean sheets, clean bed, thick towels are provided good acu all helpers are Filipina, they speak good english and they keep the rooms and theplace very clean (-) booked the room, almost a month in advance, and yet when we arrived, no room is available, we were offered the dorm (3 double beds) instead, we took it as we only plan to stay overnight, no other guests will occupy the room and had no time to argue as we need to go to different places after check in; gave us the room for free though. But good thing it wasn't our 1st time to visit HkK and only staying for a night as I don't think its a good thing to hear that "another guest decided to stay for 1 more night so we cannot accomodate you even if you booked weeks in advance" esp if it's the day after your birthday toiletries are incomplete we paid almost HK $650. You can get a room in Novotel Nathan for the same amount if i did not miss their bi annual 50% off room sale

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a little small”
Reviews.Author: CaroFerre
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, a few steps from subway, restaurants and shopping stores. The room was clean and renovated. This hotel is a little hard to find because it is located inside a residence building, so make sure you write down the address. The room was very small and there was little space for the lugagge. The internet connection was really good, very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dimariofanco
Reviews.Content: Actually, this hotel is converted from apartment. But every thing is okay (room is tidy, clean with all facility for single, wifi in room). It locates very near Jordan MRT Station on Nathan Road; The staff are friendly. Cons: some noise from air-conditioner, hard to find reception; But never mind if you have the address, go through the gateway, turn left up the stairway opposite the security box, the first door on the left is 'reception'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but small”
Reviews.Author: PsychedelicSocks
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my mum for a short shopping trip. The lodge might be a bit hard to find if you're there for the first time as there is no hotel sign facing the street. The location is about two minutes from Jordan MTR station, and there are food outlets and a convenience store nearby. The room was small but we weren't spending much time in the room - other than for basics like sleeping and showering - so it was sufficient for our needs while allowing us to save money on accommodation. The housekeeping staff are friendly and speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and excellent guesthouse”
Reviews.Author: Helenthereef
Reviews.Content: This guesthouse is central to all the amenities of Nathan Street, within walking distance of the Temple Street night market and the Ladies' street market, and easy underground rail trips from the Flower, Bird and Goldfish markets, and yet is quiet and peaceful. I couldn't have asked for better. Of all the guesthouses I emailed, this is the one who replied promptly, gave clear directions as to how to get to them, and were able to take payment on line so that I felt I truly had a confirmed booking. There is someone on reception 24 hours a day, all staff were polite, friendly and very helpful. The single en suite room was, as advertised, very small, but neat, very clean, newly decorated, had an openable window, A/C, fridge, TV, kettle, and everything I needed. Only (slight) hiccups were an small additional charge on arrival due to "incorrect exchange rate on website" (an extra HKD45 on top of a prepaid HKD650 charge), and in-room internet acess only if you bought a phone-to-laptop cable (for HKD20). Both of these were clearly explained and I did not feel they were a rip off. I'm heading back through Hong Kong in a couple of weeks, and I'll be using Comfort Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally misnamed and a rip off. I should have known when I realised it has no name up”
Reviews.Author: audirick
Reviews.Content: I chose this for location and price on the internet through a hotel booking agency, they offered no advise and take the full amount up front on your credit card details. The taxi driver didnt know it, his adminstrator didnt know it but we found it at the above address.There is no name up on the building, a very nice security man aimed at the right door.Its just a large apartment block with lift and a sleazy assortment of studio rooms in poor condition. I booked a double but they only had a twin in an adjacent building, the room was too small, jammed with poor quality fitments, the ceiling paint was peeling, the aircon was badly fitted to a hole in the wall, the beds were clean but hospital type, quite the worst accom. I have slept in ever!! No english channels on the extremely small TV set. The vanity basin was a miniature kitchen, the shower was over the toilet. The price was over 100USD a day ( 1600 HKD for 2 days) and all you get is the cell type room. My advise - only use trip advisor !

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: wingedsoul
Reviews.Content: well this is not ritz carlton for sure nor a super 8 motel. this is NOT a hotel in any sense of the word. it is a hostel within a residential building. but for the price and location, you can't beat it. mind you that the room is VERY small and so is the bed. if you are 6ft tall or over 200lbs. don't bother. also if you are staying for 1 or 2 days, not much of a saving. i am sure you can find a 3 star REAL hotel for about 600 hkd (200 more but a lot more comfortable). this place only works if you stay for at least a week or longer. location is its best virtue. there is a subway station (Jordan) right in front and you are within minutes to anywhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Lodge Hong Kong
HotelInfo.Address: No.7-8 Tak Hing Street, Block C, 6/F Knight Garden, Jordan, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
